intro: Nectolis ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous nectar plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are pollinated by insects, particularly bees and butterflies. Nectolis ambigua is noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
